bhtAttempts.bht: The pearl of great price in Matthew 13:46 represents the believer's choice of vital Christianity regardless of cost. It is not found unexpectedly in outward ordinances but through diligent spiritual search. It is discovered by someone whose business it is to seek for such treasures. In both cases, the surpassing value of the treasure is recognized, and all is parted with for it. This parable teaches that true religion is found in Christ Himself, not merely religious practices. It also reminds us that alongside the search for spiritual truth, there will be an intense investigation in the interest of Satan’s kingdom. To buy this pearl does not mean to bring any price, but rather to cheerfully relinquish the desires of the flesh and willingly embrace the heavenly life.
